snippet: An assault, apparently by a Saudi-led military coalition fighting Houthi rebels, set off an explosion that flattened homes in Sana.
abstract: At least 25 people die in explosion caused by airstrike in Sana, Yemen, stronghold of Houthi militia and primary target of Saudi-led military coalition seeking to restore exiled government; explosion, which may have been caused by bomb hitting underground munitions depot, was significantly worse than others citizens have endured in weeks of constant bombardment.

byline.original: By MOHAMMED ALI KALFOOD and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Mohammed Ali Kalfood reported from Sana, and Kareem Fahim from Djibouti.

lead_paragraph: An assault, apparently by a Saudi-led military coalition fighting Houthi rebels, set off an explosion that flattened homes in Sana.

headline.main: At Least 25 Die as Airstrike Sets Off Huge Blast in Yemen
headline.print_headline: At Least 25 Die as Airstrike Sets Off Huge Blast in Yemen
